In	O

,	O
Mr	O
.	O

Urban	GATE-patient
is	O
a	O
51	GATE-age
-year-old	O
who	O
had	O
an	O
inferior	O
myocardial	O
infarction	O
,	O
but	O
interestingly	O
during	O
his	O
hospitalization	O
had	O
systolic	O
dysfunction	O
well	O
out	O
of	O
proportion	O
to	O
his	O
coronary	O
disease	O
.	O

Also	O
,	O
his	O
systolic	O
function	O
has	O
improved	O
over	O
time	O
.	O

I	O
think	O
there	O
are	O
two	O
processes	O
going	O
on	O
.	O

One	O
is	O
coronary	O
artery	O
disease	O
.	O

Clearly	O
this	O
has	O
manifested	O
itself	O
as	O
an	O
inferior	O
myocardial	O
infarction	O
due	O
to	O
an	O
occluded	O
right	O
coronary	O
artery	O
,	O
which	O
was	O
treated	O
during	O
his	O
hospitalization	O
with	O
stenting	O
.	O

other	O
issue	O
is	O
his	O
transient	O
systolic	O
dysfunction	O
that	O
is	O
out	O
of	O
proportion	O
to	O
his	O
coronary	O
artery	O
disease	O
.	O

Given	O
the	O
rapid	O
improvement	O
in	O
his	O
ejection	O
fraction	O
,	O
I	O
can	O
only	O
speculate	O
as	O
to	O
the	O
etiology	O
of	O
this	O
.	O

He	O

to	O

but	O
a	O

.	O

I	O

that	O

is	O
myocarditis	O
.	O

no	O

.	O

to	O
